item.title: Deadly, Unna?
item.description: Deadly, Unna? by Phillip Gwynne Title: Deadly, Unna? Author: Phillip Gwynne Review: Deadly, Unna? is a captivating and thought-provoking children’s book written by Phillip Gwynne. The story follows the life of a young boy named Gary Black, who is a member of the Australian football team. Gary’s life takes an unexpected turn when he befriends a young indigenous girl named Nunga, who teaches him about her culture and the struggles her community faces.

item.title: New Policeman
item.description: New Policeman by Kate Thompson Title: The New Policeman Author: Kate Thompson Review: The New Policeman is a delightful children’s book written by Kate Thompson, which takes the readers on a magical adventure filled with music, mystery, and time travel. The story follows the journey of a young boy named J.J. Liddy, who discovers a secret passage to the land of Faerie, where time is running out. The book is targeted towards children between the ages of 8 to 12 years old, and it beautifully blends the elements of fantasy, adventure, and music.

item.title: Northern Lights
item.description: Northern Lights Title: Northern Lights Review: Northern Lights is a captivating children’s book that takes young readers on a magical journey through the enchanting world of the Arctic. This beautifully illustrated story is perfect for children aged 6 to 10 years old, as it offers a wonderful blend of adventure, friendship, and self-discovery. The story follows the life of a young Inuit girl named Annie, who lives in a small village in the Arctic.

item.title: Oh, Boy!
item.description: Oh, Boy! by Marie-Aude Murail Title: Oh, Boy! Author: Marie-Aude Murail Review: Oh, Boy! is a delightful children’s book that captures the essence of growing up and learning to navigate the complexities of life. The story follows the journey of a young boy named Nicolas as he navigates through the ups and downs of life, all while trying to find his place in the world. The book is targeted towards children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old.

item.title: Pig-Heart Boy
item.description: Pig-Heart Boy by Malorie Blackman Title: Pig-Heart Boy Author: Malorie Blackman Review: Pig-Heart Boy is a captivating children’s book written by Malorie Blackman, which explores the life of a young boy named Cameron. The story follows Cameron’s journey as he faces a life-threatening heart condition and the challenges that come with receiving a heart transplant from a pig. This book is targeted towards children aged 8-12 years old and covers important life lessons such as empathy, acceptance, and overcoming adversity.

item.title: Rosa Goes to Daycare
item.description: Rosa Goes to Daycare by Barbro Lindgren Title: Rosa Goes to Daycare Author: Barbro Lindgren Review: Rosa Goes to Daycare is a heartwarming children’s book that follows the story of Rosa, a young girl who is nervous about attending daycare for the first time. Throughout the book, Rosa learns to adjust to her new environment and make friends, ultimately overcoming her fears and enjoying her time at daycare. The book is targeted towards children between the ages of 3-6 years old, as it deals with themes such as overcoming anxiety, making friends, and adjusting to new situations.

item.title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time – Mark Haddon
item.description: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time – Mark Haddon Title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time Author: Mark Haddon Age Group: 12 years and above “The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time” is a captivating and thought-provoking novel that tells the story of Christopher Boone, a 15-year-old boy with Asperger’s Syndrome. The book takes the reader on a journey through Christopher’s unique perspective as he navigates the complexities of everyday life and solves the mystery of a murdered dog.

The book is beautifully illustrated and the artwork complements the emotional depth of the story. The target age group for this book is children between the ages of 8 and 12.

item.title: The Messenger

The story follows the life of a young boy named Matty, who possesses a unique ability to communicate with animals. Matty’s journey takes him to a mysterious village called Village, where he meets a diverse cast of characters and embarks on a quest to save the community from an impending disaster.

Hartley is a charming and whimsical children’s book that tells the tale of a young girl named Cedar, who lives in a small town with her loving family. To do so, he disguises himself as a lovable and eccentric housekeeper, Madame Doubtfire. The book is aimed at children between the ages of 8 and 12, and it beautifully explores themes of family, love, and the importance of communication.

The story follows the adventures of Hairy MacLary, a lovable and curious dog, and his canine friends. The book is filled with colorful illustrations and engaging rhymes that make it an enjoyable read for both children and adults.

item.title: Harry the Dirty Dog
item.description: Harry the Dirty Dog by Gene Zion Title: Harry the Dirty Dog Author: Gene Zion Illustrator: Margaret Bloy Graham Harry the Dirty Dog is a charming children’s book written by Gene Zion and illustrated by Margaret Bloy Graham. This delightful story is about a white dog with black spots named Harry, who hates taking baths. One day, Harry decides to run away from home to avoid a bath. In his adventures, Harry gets so dirty that his family doesn’t recognize him, and he almost loses his home.

item.title: Lyle, Lyle Crocodile
item.description: Lyle, Lyle Crocodile by Bernard Waber Title: Lyle, Lyle Crocodile Author: Bernard Waber Review: Lyle, Lyle Crocodile is a charming and delightful children’s book written by Bernard Waber. The story revolves around a friendly crocodile named Lyle, who lives in a house on East 88th Street in New York City with the Primm family. Lyle loves to sing and perform, and he becomes a beloved member of the community. The book is aimed at children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old.

item.title: My Cat Likes to Hide in Boxes
item.description: My Cat Likes to Hide in Boxes by Eve Sutton Title: “My Cat Likes to Hide in Boxes” Author: Eve Sutton Review: “My Cat Likes to Hide in Boxes” is a charming and delightful children’s book that tells the story of a cat who loves to hide in various boxes. The book is perfect for children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old, as it features simple and engaging language, accompanied by vibrant and colorful illustrations.

item.title: Pancakes for Findus
item.description: Pancakes for Findus by Sven Nordqvist Title: Pancakes for Findus Author: Sven Nordqvist “Pancakes for Findus” is a delightful children’s book written by Sven Nordqvist, which tells the story of an old man named Farmer Pettson and his curious cat, Findus. The book is a part of a series that revolves around the adventures of Pettson and Findus, and this particular story focuses on the duo’s attempt to make pancakes together.

item.title: Peace at Last
item.description: Peace at Last Title: Peace at Last Author: Jill Murphy Target Age Group: 4-8 years old Review: “Peace at Last” is a delightful children’s book written by Jill Murphy, which takes young readers on a heartwarming adventure with the endearing Mr. Bear and his family. The story follows Mr. Bear as he tries to find a quiet place to sleep after being constantly disturbed by the noises made by his family members.

item.title: Postman Pat's Treasure Hunt
item.description: Postman Pat’s Treasure Hunt by John a Cunliffe Title: Postman Pat’s Treasure Hunt Author: John A. item.title: The Cat in the Hat
item.description: The Cat in the Hat by Dr. Seuss Title: The Cat in the Hat Author: Dr. Seuss Review: The Cat in the Hat is a delightful children’s book written by the renowned author Dr. Seuss. The story follows the adventures of a mischievous cat who visits two children, Sally and her brother, on a rainy day. The Cat in the Hat teaches valuable life lessons while keeping the reader entertained with its whimsical rhymes and colorful illustrations.

item.description: Uppo the Bear by Elina Karjalainen Title: Uppo the Bear Author: Elina Karjalainen Review: Uppo the Bear is a delightful children’s book written by Elina Karjalainen, which follows the adventures of a curious and lovable bear named Uppo. The story is set in a magical forest filled with enchanting creatures and vibrant landscapes, making it an engaging read for young children. The book is aimed at children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old.

item.title: We Are the Triplets

The story is told through colorful illustrations and simple, engaging text that will capture the attention of young readers. item.title: What Does the Mouse Think on Thursday
item.description: What Does the Mouse Think on Thursday by Josef Guggenmos Title: “What Does the Mouse Think on Thursday” Author: Josef Guggenmos Review: “What Does the Mouse Think on Thursday” is a charming children’s book that follows the adventures of a curious little mouse named Tuffy. The story takes place over the course of a week, with each day bringing new discoveries and experiences for Tuffy. The book is written in a simple and engaging manner, making it perfect for young readers.

item.title: Curious George
item.description: Curious George Title: Curious George Author: H.A. Rey Age Group: 4-8 years old Curious George is a classic children’s book written by H.A. Rey, first published in 1941. The story follows the adventures of a mischievous monkey named George, who is brought from his home in the jungle to live in a big city. Throughout the book, George gets into various situations as he explores his new surroundings, all while learning valuable life lessons.

item.title: Humphrey's Corner
item.description: Humphrey’s Corner by Sally Hunter Title: Humphrey’s Corner Author: Sally Hunter Humphrey’s Corner is a delightful children’s book that tells the story of Humphrey, a lovable and curious hamster, who embarks on a journey of self-discovery and friendship. Sally Hunter’s charming illustrations and engaging narrative make this book an excellent choice for children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old. The book targets a young audience, teaching them valuable life lessons through Humphrey’s adventures.

item.title: Julian the Rabbit

The story follows Julian, a curious and adventurous rabbit who embarks on a journey to discover the true meaning of friendship and the importance of embracing one’s unique qualities.

item.title: Make Way for Ducklings
item.description: Make Way for Ducklings Title: Make Way for Ducklings Author: Robert McCloskey Target Age Group: 4-8 years old “Make Way for Ducklings” is a timeless classic written by Robert McCloskey, which has been capturing the hearts of young readers since its publication in 1941. The book is beautifully illustrated, with detailed drawings that bring the characters to life.

item.title: The Quangle Wangle's Hat

item.title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
item.description: The Tale of Peter Rabbit Title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit Author: Beatrix Potter Review: The Tale of Peter Rabbit is a timeless classic written by Beatrix Potter, which has been entertaining children and adults alike for generations.
